subject: VMED
name: Financial Planning
fullname: Financial Planning for the Small Business and You
info: Principles/practice of farm/personal finance, interpreting financial statements, calculating financial return, setting goals, budgeting, analysis of decision making, time value of money, comparisons on investments, portfolio diversification, analysis of risk, impact of asset allocation.

subject: VMED
name: Prob Dis Cont Erad
fullname: Problems in Disease Control and Eradication
info: Past and present disease control and eradication programs; factors influencing success and failure. Development of models for programs in the United States or a foreign country for group evaluation and analysis.

subject: VMED
name: Prob Vet Epi PHlth
fullname: Problems in Veterinary Epidemiology and Public Health
info: Individual study on problem of interest to epidemiology or public health student.

subject: VMED
name: Diag Epi of Infectious Disease
info: Theoretical principles, practical applications of diagnostic testing in populations. Examples related to infectious diseases in veterinary/human health. Basis of test performance, limitations, interpretations.prereq: Statistics course or instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Seminar: Vet Epi
info: Each student leads at least one seminar. Reviews of current research, literature reviews, and technique development. Students and participating faculty participate in presentation, discussion, and administration of the seminars.prereq: Veterinary Medicine grad student

subject: VMED
name: Dir Studies - Pop Med
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
name: Basis of Nanoparticle Toxicity
fullname: Molecular and Cellular Basis of Nanoparticle Toxicity
info: Use of nanotechnology in scientific research. Impact of nanomaterials on biological systems.

subject: VMED
name: Surveillance Foodborne Disease
fullname: Surveillance of Foodborne Diseases and Food Safety Hazards
info: Principles/methods for surveillance of foodborne diseases.  Investigation of outbreaks. Assessment of food safety hazards. Focuses on integration of epidemiologic/lab methods.prereq: [PUBH 5330, [professional school or grad student]] or instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Ecology of Infectious Disease
info: How host, agent, environmental interactions influence transmission of infectious agents. Environmental dissemination, eradication/control, evolution of virulence. Use of analytical/molecular tools.

subject: VMED
name: Spatial Analysis Infec Dis Epi
fullname: Spatial Analysis in Infectious Disease Epidemiology
info: Spatial distribution of disease events. Exposures/outcomes. Factors that determine where diseases occur. Analyzing spatial disease data in public health, geography, epidemiology. Focuses on human/animal health related examples.prereq: Intro to epidemiology, statistics,

subject: VMED
name: Molecular Bio Pub Health Prof
fullname: Molecular biology for the Public Health Professional
info: This course focuses on introducing students to molecular biology lab tools that are used to investigate infectious diseases in public health settings.  The course combines laboratory sessions during which students will learn and run molecular assays with computer lab sessions during which students will analyze molecular data.

subject: VMED
name: Effective Science Comm
info: Skills needed to research, organize, develop, and deliver an oral scientific presentation or to assist in finding, compiling, and organizing information for presentations, theses, or papers suitable for publication.prereq: Grad student

subject: VMED
name: Dairy Financial Decisions
fullname: Dairy Decision Making in a Financial Context for Veterinarians
info: Concepts/tools of economic analysis needed to support decision making on dairy farms, particularly as those decisions relate to health, disease impact, nutrition, general farm management.Prereq Earned DVM, instr consent.

subject: VMED
name: Dairy Production Medicine
info: Intense eight week course designed to develop advanced knowledge/skills in dairy production medicine. Mixture of lectures, wetlabs, farm investipations, presentations. Held at Dairy Education Center at New Sweden Dairy.prereq: DVM degree, instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Large Animal Physiology I
info: Review of large animal physiology at level needed for specialty board certification or beginning research. Students present topics in physiology and supplement reading with clinical case material or journal articles.

subject: VMED
name: Large Animal Physiology II
info: Large animal physiology for specialty board certification or beginning research. Students present topics in physiology and supplement reading with clinical case material or journal articles.prereq: instr consent; 5210 recommended

subject: VMED
name: Large Animal Diagn Ultras
info: Fundamentals of diagnostic ultrasound in large animal patient. Ultrasonography of the equine limbs/joints, large animal abdomen/thorax. Lectures, lab.

subject: VMED
name: Clin Vet Derm Path
info: Microscopic pathology of basic dermatologic reactions and of variable disease states.prereq: DVM degree or foreign equiv

subject: VMED
name: Adv Small Animal Patho I
info: Biology, physiology, pathophysiology, and medicine of disciplines relevant to companion animals. Pathogenesis/treatment of diseases. Developing hypotheses that can be translated into clinical research.Prereq CVM grad student, [DVM or foreign equiv] degree.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Small Animal Patho II
info: Overview of biology, physiology, pathophysiology, and medicine of disciplines. Underlying pathogenesis/treatment of diseases of companion animals. Developing hypotheses that could be translated into clinical research.Prereq CVM grad student, [DVM or foreign equiv] degree.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Small Animal Patho III
info: Overview of biology, physiology, pathophysiology, and medicine. Underlying pathogenesis/treatment of diseases of companion animals. Developing hypotheses that could be translated into clinical research.Prereq CVM grad student, [DVM or foreign equivalent] degree.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Small Animal Patho IV
info: Overview of biology, physiology, pathophysiology, and medicine. Underlying pathogenesis/treatment of diseases of companion animals. Developing hypotheses that could be translated into clinical research.Prereq CVM grad student, [DVM or foreign equiv] degree.

subject: VMED
name: Urinary System Disease
info: Expands on disorders of small animal urinary system. Introduction to core and to additional disorders.

subject: VMED
name: Indep Study Vet Med
info: Arranged independent study in a clinical area of veterinary medicine.

subject: VMED
name: Dir Studies - Comp Med & Patho
fullname: Directed Studies in Comparative Medicine and Pathology
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
name: LA Clinical Medicine/Surgery
fullname: Problems in Large Animal Clinical Medicine/Surgery and Theriogenology
info: Hospital cases using standardized format, audiovisual aids. Review literature pertaining to case. One or two cases presented by enrolled participants per month.prereq: VMed grad student, possess DVM

subject: VMED
name: Topics in Vet Clinical Patho
info: Modified rounds format. Cases from VMC used to explore cytology with associated chemistry/hematology data. Attendees/clinicians can request lab topics for dicussion. Past topics have included lab measurement of chemical analytes, test sensitivity or specificity (e.g., ethylene glycol test, FELV test), lab testing for infectious agents.prereq: Grad student in CVM

subject: VMED
name: Veterinary Gross Pathology
info: Diagnosing gross lesions of tissues. Evaluating images from wide variety of animals submitted to lab. Mock exams. Students prepare two in-depth reviews on topics covered during in course.Prereq Grad student in CMB or [VMED, [DVM degree or foreign equivalent], college consent]

subject: VMED
name: Adv. Vet. Systemic Path I
info: Students review/summarize topics in systemic pathology using veterinary pathology textbooks and relevant updates from pathology and veterinary medical journals. Diagnostic cases in alimentary, respiratory, urinary, cardiovascular, and hematopoietic system pathology. Students give 10-15 presentations with handouts for other students.prereq: Grad student in VMED or [CMB, [DVM degree or foreign equiv]] or instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Adv. Vet. Systemic Path. II
info: Students review/summarize topics in systemic pathology using veterinary pathology textbooks and relevant updates from pathology and veterinary medical journals. Representative diagnostic cases in endocrine, reproductive, musculoskeletal, nervous, special senses, and integumentary system pathology. Student give 10-15 presentations with handouts for other students.

subject: VMED
name: Veterinary Descript. Histopath
info: Weekly, one-hour microscopic slide prsentations, reviews on wide variety of diseases in domestic/non-domestic animals.  Students present microscopic slide cases and prepare discussions about disease entities, differential diagnoses, and ancillary tests.prereq: Grad student in VMED or [CMB, [DVM degree or foreign equiv]] or instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Vet Diagnostic & Comp Patho
info: Diagnostic skills in gross/microscopic pathology. Students participate in necropsy services of veterinary diagnostic lab, examine carcasses from variety of animals. Case write-ups, interpretation of gross/microscopic lesions done under supervision of faculty pathologists. Students assist in supervision of veterinary students on senior necropsy rotation.

subject: VMED
name: Prob in Vet and Comp Pathology
fullname: Problems in Veterinary and Comparative Pathology
info: Case material in Veterinary Diagnostic Lab. Students investigate pathogenesis/epidemiology of selected disease condition or case-related problem agreed upon with faculty pathologist.

subject: VMED
name: Scientific Writing & Speaking
info: Techniques of writing/publishing papers/theses. Manuscript preparation. Submission/review process. Proofreading. Publishing processes. Grant Writing. Oral/poster presentations at sceintific meetings.prereq: Grad student in health sciences

subject: VMED
name: Molecular Epidem Infec Dis
info: Impact, application, and interpretation of molecular techniques in understanding etiology, transmission, and control of infectious diseases important to animal and public health. Theoretical/practical aspects of molecular biology methods in context of epidemiological studies of infectious diseases, including bacterial/viral infections of veterinary/zoonotic significance. Population and evolutionary genetics of pathogenic microorganisms. Data analysis/interpretation. Design of descriptive/hypothesis-driven epidemiological studies involving molecular techniques.prereq: Basic course in microbiology

subject: VMED
name: HIV/AIDS: Patho, Treatm, Preve
info: Exposure to pathogenesis, treatment, and prevention of HIV/AIDS from clinical faculty who are dealing with AIDS patients. Developing new questions and design experiments that have greatest chance of translating to clinical setting.prereq: Grad student

subject: VMED
name: Using Risk Analysis Tools
fullname: Using Risk Analysis Tools:  Estimating Food Safety Risks on the Farm to Table Continuum
info: This applications-based course will provide the necessary risk-based tools to evaluate and mitigate the microbial and chemical risks in a food production chain-from the farm until consumption.  Students will follow the risk analysis process as an integral part of  science-based decision-making to estimate and manage food safety risks. Students will apply different qualitative and quantitative tools by using a computer.

subject: VMED
name: Quant Mthds Popltn Health
info: This course reviews the principles and application of advanced methods for analysis of population health data, with a focus on animal health and infectious diseases. Analytical techniques that will be taught and applied during the course include risk assessment, spatial analysis, disease modeling, and disease economics.

subject: VMED
name: One Hlth & Infec Dis Wildlife
fullname: Seminar: One Health and Infectious Diseases of Wildlife
info: The course will explore the applied concept of One Health and infectious diseases of wildlife in weekly case studies. In each case study, students will gain an understanding of system dynamics, infer the interplay between humans, animals and the environment in the context of a given wildlife disease, and confront current disease management practices and challenges for successfully mediating transmission and spread.

subject: VMED
name: Dir Studies - Inf Dis
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
name: Training in Swine Prod. Mngmt.
fullname: Training in Swine Production and Management
info: Production module introduces techniques/protocols for swine production system operation. Research module covers applied research trials for viral/bacterial pathogens in pigs.prereq: VMED grad student or instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Biohazard Vet Med
info: For veterinary medicine graduate students who expect to assume supervisory responsibility for design and safe operation of laboratories in veterinary research, teaching, regulatory, or commercial institutions.

subject: VMED
name: Research Veterinary Medicine
info: Independent study as determined by instructor. Usual activity includes conducting research in instructor's lab, though research in field may also be included.prereq: Jr, instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Swine Dis Diagn
info: Review of recent advances in swine diseases; farm visits for on-farm disease diagnostics and control programs.

subject: VMED
name: Companion Animal Oncology
info: Principles of veterinary oncology. Biologic behaviors, treatments, and prognosis of neoplastic disorders.

subject: VMED
name: Prin Veterinary Anesthesiology
info: In-depth training in principles of veterinary anesthesiology. Lectures, anesthesia labs, presentations by students.prereq: VMed grad student, [DVM degree or foreign equiv], instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Bovine Surgery Practicum
info: Intensive training in ruminant surgery. Evaluation of food animal surgery principles, hands-on laboratory components.prereq: [VMed grad student, [DVM or equiv foreign degree]] or instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Ind Res Vet  Anesthesiology
info: Independent research supervised by faculty member.

subject: VMED
name: Dir Studies - SRA
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
name: SA Orthopedic Radiology
info: Roentgen signs of common bone diseases of small animals.

subject: VMED
name: Lag Anim Ortho Rad
info: Roentgen signs of common bone diseases of large animals. Emphasizes the horse.

subject: VMED
name: Food Prod, Proc, Sply Chain
fullname: Food Production, Processing, and Supply Chain
info: Food commodities and agricultural crops play critical roles relevant to public health, energy and economic vitality, feeding the increasing global human population, and providing multiple outputs from feed for animals, to fuel for vehicles, transportation and energy. This course focuses on agricultural commodities. For 2019 we will focus on corn and dairy production systems in Minnesota. The commodity of interest will change from year-to-year to other commodities like pork and sugar beets – which provide critical outputs for the state of Minnesota.

subject: VMED
name: Dir Studies - Therio
info: Directed studies arranged between student and instructor.

subject: VMED
name: Vet Pub Hlth Learning Exper
fullname: Veterinary Public Health Integrated Learning Experience
info: Part of the curriculum for the master's degree includes an opportunity for students to develop a written document detailing applications of public health practice. Completion of the ILE allows students to synthesize aspects of public health into a document that can be utilized by public health professionals.

subject: VMED
name: Application of Vet Pub Hlth
info: The APEx, applied practice experience provides students an opportunity to learn first-hand about the organization, operations, and special activities of selected agencies, institutions and industries concerned with public health practice. This is a means of gaining additional insight into public health programs, personnel management, governmental relations, public relations, legislative support and, particularly, knowledge of special investigations or responses conducted by these organizations. Participation in the activities of public health practice programs external to the University adds a dimension of experience to the curriculum that enriches the student's training and may be beneficial in seeking employment.

subject: VMED
name: Grantwriting
fullname: Grant Writing: What Makes a Winning Proposal?
info: Components of a strong proposal. Grant submission process. What reviewers look for. How to locate grant announcements that match research interests.

subject: VMED
name: Essential Stats for Life Sci
info: This course is a broad overview of the principles and methods of statistical analysis used in life sciences research, including biological, veterinary, and translational research, and provides the background a new researcher needs to understand and apply commonly used statistical methods and the preparation needed for more advanced coursework.Classes will include general instruction and background information, detailed examples of how to perform the analyses, with actual data sets, and discussion on how the topic has been applied in biological research, including reading and assessing papers in the field. Computing will be performed using the R software environment, though students may use alternate software with permission.Topics will include: Descriptive statistics and exploratory graphics Understanding statistical inference and interpreting P-values and confidence intervals. One and two sample inference, including t-tests, proportion tests, and non-parametric alternatives Linear regression, including the effects of confounders ANOVA methods, including pairwise comparisons and multiple comparisons

subject: VMED
name: Food Defense: Prep, Rspd, Rcvr
info: Basic principles of preparedness/emergency response. Instructor may substitute topics if timelier topic arises.prereq: Grad or professional student or instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Food Defense Awareness
fullname: Protecting your Lunch: Food Defense Awareness
info: Protecting your Lunch: Food Defense Awareness presents current issues, challenges, concerns, and activities impacting global food defense. "Food Defense" is the sum of actions and activities related to prevention, protection, mitigation, response, and recovery of the food system from intentional acts of adulteration and disruption. This includes intentional acts from both terrorism and criminal activities. This topics course incorporates case studies as well as current events that directly relate to food system disruption, cause food supply chain interruption, or may provoke intentional adulteration or food fraud.

subject: VMED
name: AMR: One Health Perspective
fullname: Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR) from a One Health Perspective
info: Fundamentals of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) development, transmission, and risks to humans, animals, and the environment delivered by experts in the One Health concept (interconnection between people, animals, plants, and their shared environment). Review and development of research-based resources and methods for communicating scientific information to non-academic audiences. Multi-institution collaboration with online engagement during class meetings.

subject: VMED
name: Intro to Applied Health Policy
fullname: Introduction to Applied Health Policy and Leadership
info: This course introduces students to policy analysis and leadership tools to navigate the complexities of policy-making and foster policy dialogue and action. We will apply a health lens to discuss contemporary policy issues, explore the different stages of the policy cycle, map the polarities of complex challenges, and apply implementation science techniques to guide policies from theory to impact. May be of particular interest to graduate students in the academic health sciences or HHH/OLPD.prereq: Graduate or professional degree in-progress or completed.

subject: VMED
name: Vet Public Practice Seminar
info: Interactive review of current public practice topics in environmental health/toxicology, infectious/parasitic diseases, public health administration/education, epidemiology and biostatistics, and food safety.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Clinical Epi
info: An in-depth focus on infectious disease epidemiology, with opportunities to apply epidemiologic principles to control infectious diseases in animal populations.

subject: VMED
name: Ldrshp to Addr Global Grand Ch
fullname: Leadership to Address Global Grand Challenges
info: In this 5-day skills-based course, participants will learn and apply integrative leadership (also known as shared or facilitative leadership) strategies for addressing global grand challenges. Using global food system challenges as a basis for exploration, we will focus on leadership practices that foster collective action across diverse groups of people.

subject: VMED
name: Intro to Teaching Skills
info: This is a hybrid series of modules and face-to-face course sessions, and experiential learning guiding veterinary students through best practices to enhance efficacy as an instructor in a veterinary curriculum. Specific topics include learning theory, building a course session, teaching presentations, and individual student assessment.

subject: VMED
name: Veterinary Public Prac Seminar
info: Interactive review of current public practice topics in infectious and parasitic diseases, epidemiology and stats, food safety, environmental health, and toxicology.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Sw Dis
info: Lectures and discussion on advances in diseases of swine.

subject: VMED
name: Swine Production Systems
info: Swine production systems.  Design, construction, staffing, pig flow, and financial aspects.

subject: VMED
name: Swine Nutrition
info: Nutritional principles and concepts in swine nutrition.

subject: VMED
name: Swine Records
info: How to interpret data from computer health management program.

subject: VMED
name: An Hlth Fd Sys Policy Intergov
fullname: Animal Health and Food System Policy and Intergovernmental Organizations
info: Evidence-based policy development. Relevant global animal health and food system issue. Role of scientific evidence in developing/implementing policy and in intergovernmental organization's policy development. Policy-making process as it pertains to trade, animal health, and food system across intergovernmental organizations.

subject: VMED
name: An Hlth Fd Sys Policy Ntnl Gov
fullname: Animal Health and Food System Policy and U.S. National Government
info: Evidence-based policy development for a global animal health and food system issue. Visits to Washington, DC. Interactions with key leaders from various organizations/agencies. Integrating skills in animal health, public health, communication, and food security with national/international animal health policy.

subject: VMED
name: An Hlth Fd Sy Policy State Gov
fullname: Animal Health and Food System Policy and U.S. State Government
info: Policy-making process as it pertains to animal health, public health, and food systems at the state and provincial levels. Global animal health, public health, and food system issue with a particular emphasis on the interplay of science, politics and belief in developing and implementing policy associated.

subject: VMED
name: Engaging Intergovernmental Org
info: How to engage intergovernmental organizations in global policy development for trade, capacity building, and development. Students develop a network of contacts in organizations to access additional reference materials, understand who to contact for specific issues. Intergovernmental organizations: World Trade Organization, World Health Organization, World Organization for Animal Health and Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Impacting veterinary public health domestically/globally.

subject: VMED
name: Epi Zoonoses
fullname: Epidemiology of Zoonoses and Diseases Common to Animals and Humans
info: Major human zoonotic diseases, methods of transmission, diagnosis, control, and prevention.prereq: Epidemiology and infectious disease course or instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Ethical Conduct/An Research
info: Ethical considerations in use of animal subjects in agricultural, veterinary, and biomedical research. Federal, state, and University guidelines relating to proper conduct for acquisition/use of animals for laboratory, observational, epidemiological, and clinical research. Regulatory requirements. Bases for proper conduct. Societal impact on scientific investigations utilizing animal subjects.

subject: VMED
name: Dairy Hlth Mngmnt: Crit Think
info: Group discussions surrounding critical evaluations of scientific journal articles and dairy-related scientific presentations. Facilitated by both students and faculty.

subject: VMED
name: Welfare of Farmed Animals
info: This course covers topics on the evaluation and assessment of the welfare of farmed animals. Literature review, discussions, and analyses are used to increase skills needed to evaluate methods for improving the welfare of farmed animals in various situations.

subject: VMED
name: Food Safety, VPH
fullname: Pre-Harvest Food Safety and Public Health Aspects of Food Animal Production
info: Includes presentations and discussions on on-farm HACCP principles and prudent use of antibiotics.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Sm An Vet Med
info: Discussions of diseases of organs or systems in animals, including degenerative, psychological, anomolous, metabolic, nutritional, neoplastic, immune, inflammatory, toxic, and traumatic disorders.

subject: VMED
name: Int Med Sm Anim
fullname: Internal Medicine in Small Companion Animals
info: Lectures, assigned readings, and discussions on internal medical problems of dogs and cats.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Dx Rx Anim Dis
fullname: Advanced Diagnosis and Therapeutics of Animal Disease
info: Detailed examination, treatment, and discussion of naturally occurring disease in patients admitted to Veterinary Medical Center.

subject: VMED
name: Seminar Vet Med
info: Participation and presentations of regularly scheduled seminars about internal medicine.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Nephr/Uro Clin
info: Clinical investigation of naturally occurring urinary diseases in patients admitted to Veterinary Medical Center.prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Med Conf
info: Participation in weekly conference about internal medical disorders.prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Acid-Base, Lytes
fullname: Problems in Acid-base, Electrolyte, and Fluid Metabolism
info: Clinical problems and physiology of acid-base, electrolyte, and fluid disorders of dogs and cats.prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Journ Club: Lrg Anim Int Med
fullname: Journal Club: Large Animal Internal Medicine
info: Students/faculty keep abreast of current literature in large animal internal medicine. Students critically evaluate the literature.prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Adv Stu Neph/Uro
fullname: Advanced Studies in Nephrology and Urology
info: Studies of urinary tract disease with goal of generating new knowledge.prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Res Nephrol/Urology
fullname: Research Studies in Nephrology and Urology
info: Individual research on selected problems

subject: VMED
name: Adv Lg An Vet Med
info: Discussions of diseases of organs or systems in animals in a clinical setting.

subject: VMED
name: FTE: Master's
info: (No description)prereq: Master's student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: VMED
name: Evidence Based Med
info: Concepts of evidence-based medicine with emphasis on veterinary clinical evidence will be presented. Clinical questions, development of study designs, identification of literature and assessment of the impact of the literature on clinical decisions.prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Vet Clin Skills Teach & Pract
fullname: Directed Veterinary Clinical Skills Teaching - lecture and lab
info: This course involves directed work in the best practices for general veterinary clinical teaching and specific veterinary clinical skills teaching, and applying those practices in teaching laboratories for 1st, 2nd and 3rd year veterinary students. It is intended for U of MN graduate students who have a DVM or equivalent degree and  will potentially  be involved in clinical teaching of DVM students in their future career plans.

subject: VMED
name: Vet Clin Skills Lab Teaching
fullname: Directed Veterinary Clinical Skills:  Laboratory Teaching
info: This course involves directed work in the best practices for general veterinary clinical teaching and specific veterinary clinical skills teaching, and applying those practices in teaching laboratories for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd year veterinary students. It is intended for U of MN graduate students who have a DVM or equivalent degree and  will potentially  be involved in clinical teaching of DVM students in their future career plans. There are 9 required laboratory teaching sessions as assigned by the laboratory instructor in the spring and for any semesters as determined in consultation with the student about their areas of knowledge and interest for teaching clinical skills.

subject: VMED
name: Med Conf
info: Medical, surgical, or obstetrical cases supported by anatomic, bacteriologic, pathologic, physiologic, pharmacologic, and radiologic evaluations whenever applicable.

subject: VMED
name: Research Vet Med
info: Research problems relating to any aspect of internal medicine or to the various systems in animals.prereq: instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Diag An Dis
fullname: Diagnostic and Therapeutic Techniques of Animal Diseases
info: Detailed examination, discussions, and treatments of cases of animal diseases in a clinical setting.

subject: VMED
name: FTE: Doctoral
info: (No description)prereq: Doctoral student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: VMED
name: Sem: Inf Dis SwMed
fullname: Seminar: Infectious Diseases and Swine Medicine
info: Students, faculty, and guest speakers present seminars on current research in diagnosis, control, and treatment of infectious diseases.

subject: VMED
name: Res Infect Dis
info: Directed research.

subject: VMED
name: Prob Infect Dis
info: In-depth discussion on specific problems for various infectious diseases of farm animals.

subject: VMED
name: Translational Animal Models
info: This course will be taught by experts who have successfully developed or utilized translational animalmodels of human diseases. An overview of comparative and translational research will be presented anddiscussed including a comparison of naturally occurring vs experimental models of diseases. We willreview 12 animal models and use them as examples to discuss the challenges faced during modeldevelopment, relevance of the selected models to other animal species and humans, and theadvantages/disadvantages of each animal model. Strategies to determine when an animal model isappropriate for a given application will be discussed. During this course each participant will develop andpresent their own idea of a translational animal model (naturally occurring or experimental) in their areaof research interest.The class will be alternate each week between the participating institutions. It will be held in person bythe hosting institution and participants from other institutions and will participate via Zoom or anotheronline platform. The instructor will generally be located at the host institution and will participate inperson at that school, but occasionally instructors will participate remotely via Zoom.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Immunol
info: Lectures and case presentations.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Sw Dis
info: Lectures and discussion on advances.

subject: VMED
name: VMED Seminar
info: Seminar. Exposure to research activities of CMB and VMED students and faculty. Students prepare/present a 20 minute seminar on their original research.prereq: Grad student

subject: VMED
name: Research & Literature Vet Med
fullname: Research and Literature Reports in Veterinary Medicine
info: A combination of literature review, group discussions and analyses are utilized to improve participants' capacity to critically evaluate scientific journal articles. Scientific research presentations will be led by students or faculty.

subject: VMED
name: InfDisJnlsCritRead
info: This course is intended to discuss published papers, experimental methods, approaches, diseases and animal health problems with the goal of promoting critical thinking. Students will be responsible for identifying, reviewing and sharing relevant material as well as leading discussion of their assigned class meeting.

subject: VMED
name: AdvVet Virol/Serol
info: Discussion and laboratory practice.

subject: VMED
name: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr
info: tbdprereq: Doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: VMED
name: Prob VetCritCare
fullname: Problems in Veterinary Critical Care/Emergency Medicine

subject: VMED
name: AdvVetCritCareEmer
info: Discussions of current topics, focusing on literature and research results in periodicals, proceedings, texts.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Sm An Surg
info: Advanced techniques and procedures.

subject: VMED
name: Adv Lg An Surg
info: Surgery of various systems in large animals, with preoperative and postoperative evaluation and management.prereq: DVM or equiv degree, instr consent

subject: VMED
name: G.I. Surg
info: Advanced techniques and problems.

subject: VMED
name: Surg Phys
info: Discussions on pathophysiology of surgical diseases in dogs and cats.

subject: VMED
name: NeuroSurg
info: Advanced neurosurgical diseases of small animals amenable to surgical treatment.

subject: VMED
name: Thor & CV Surg
info: Advanced thoracic and cardiovascular diseases of small animals amenable to surgical treatment.

subject: VMED
name: Plast & Recon Surg
info: Advanced techniques in conditions of small animals.

subject: VMED
name: New Tech Lg An Sx
fullname: New Techniques in Large Animal Surgery
info: New techniques in large animal surgery.

subject: VMED
name: Urogen Surg
info: Advanced techniques in treatment of small animals.

subject: VMED
name: Res: Lg An Surg
info: Independent research projects.

subject: VMED
name: Sem Sm An Surg
info: Discussions of problems and case analysis.

subject: VMED
name: Sem: Lg An Vet Sx
info: Discussion of current literature and surgery board preparation.prereq: DVM or equiv degree, instr consent

subject: VMED
name: Res Vet Surg
info: Research in small animal surgery.

subject: VMED
name: Prob in Lg An Surg
info: New techniques and procedures in large animal orthopedic surgery.

subject: VMED
name: ResCritCare/EmerMed
info: Special problems course. Controlled study; prospective and retrospective models of evaluation are defined, critiqued, and used for experimental design and data collection to validate research methods.prereq: DVM or equiv degree

subject: VMED
name: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info: (No description)prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [Plan A only]

subject: VMED
name: Av Crit Care
fullname: Advanced Avian Critical Care: Principles and Procedures
info: Procedures and protocols for managing avian medical emergencies such as starvation, toxicities, respiratory failure, and massive trauma.prereq: Course each in vet pathology, physiology, pharmacology, anatomy, small animal anesthesiology and critical care

subject: VMED
name: SEM: Adv Vet Anes
info: Active interaction around topics of advanced anesthesiology in veterinary species.prereq: [[CVM 6321, CVM 6322] or equiv], grad student

subject: VMED
name: Adv Vet Abd Imag
info: Applications and discussion of basic principles through emerging techniques.
